title: A simple pendulum on the Moon

content.question: A simple pendulum is constructed by hanging a ball at the end of a string. The pendulum has a period of <math alttext="1.0 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mtext> s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> on Earth. Which of the following could allow the pendulum to have a period of <math alttext="1.0 second " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mtext> s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> on the Moon?

choices.label: Increasing the mass of the ball
Decreasing the mass of the ball
Increasing the length of the pendulum
Decreasing the length of the pendulum
Keeping both the mass of the ball and the length of the pendulum the same

content.answer: Decreasing the length of the pendulum

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
